name: A. Stones on the Table
statement:
There are stones on the table in a row, each of them can be red, green
or blue. Count the minimum number of stones to take from the table so
that any two neighboring stones had different colors. Stones in a row
are considered neighboring if there are no other stones between them.
editorial:
In this problem you should count number of consecutive pairs of equal
letters. It can be done using one cycle and time.
